snippet: The Justice Department said the Social Security Administration would apply the Supreme Court’s June ruling declaring marriage a constitutional right retroactively.
abstract: Justice Dept announces it will retroactively apply Supreme Court's June ruling legalizing gay marriage nationally to same-sex married couples who had previously filed claims for Social Security benefits in states that did not recognize their marriages.
lead_paragraph: The Justice Department said the Social Security Administration would apply the Supreme Court’s June ruling declaring marriage a constitutional right retroactively.

headline.main: Gay Couples Are Eligible for Social Security Benefits, U.S. Decides
